supporting_quotes: a member of Communist Party of Soviet Union from 1979.
events.notes: Role is a membership in the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, starting in 1979.

roles: teacher and headmaster of the 1st Secondary School of Valmiera
supporting_quotes:
Earlier in his career, while Latvia was still part of the
Soviet Union
, Andris Piebalgs worked as a teacher and was the headmaster of the 1st Secondary School of Valmiera (1980–1990).
events.notes: Role as teacher and headmaster in Valmiera during the Soviet Union era.

supporting_quotes: He also served as director of the department in the Ministry of Education in Latvia.
events.notes: Role as director of a department in the Ministry of Education in Latvia, no specific time period mentioned.

supporting_quotes: In 1993, Andris Piebalgs won a seat in the Latvian Parliament,
events.notes: Won a seat in the Latvian Parliament in 1993.

roles: chairman of the budget and finance committee
supporting_quotes: He served as the chairman of the budget and finance committee until 1994.
events.notes: Served as chairman of the budget and finance committee until 1994.

events.canonical_org_name: Finanšu Ministrija (Ministry of Finance of Latvia)
supporting_quotes: In September 1994, he became Latvia's Minister of Finance and deputy prime minister.
events.notes: Became Minister of Finance and deputy prime minister of Latvia in September 1994.

supporting_quotes: From 1995 until 2003, he worked in the Latvian Diplomatic service.
events.notes: Worked in the Latvian Diplomatic Service from 1995 to 2003.

supporting_quotes: Andris Piebalgs first served as the ambassador of Latvia in Estonia (1995–1997),
events.notes: Served as ambassador of Latvia in Estonia from 1995 to 1997.

supporting_quotes: In 1997 he became the Latvian Ambassador to the EU.
events.notes: Became Latvian Ambassador to the EU in 1997.

events.canonical_org_name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Latvia
roles: Deputy Secretary of State for EU affairs
supporting_quotes: From 2003 to 2004, he was appointed Deputy Secretary of State for EU affairs at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Latvia.
events.notes: Appointed Deputy Secretary of State for EU affairs at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Latvia from 2003 to 2004.
Served as European Commissioner for Energy from 2004 to 2010.

supporting_quotes:
Between 2004 and 2009 he served as
Commissioner for Energy
.
events.notes: Served as Commissioner for Energy from 2004 to 2009.

supporting_quotes: During the first Barroso Commission, starting in November 2004, he was the European Commissioner for Energy.
events.notes: Became European Commissioner for Energy during the first Barroso Commission, starting in November 2004.

events.canonical_org_name: Regional Chamber of Commerce in Katowice
supporting_quotes: Andris Piebalgs received the 'Diamond Prize' from the Regional Chamber of Commerce in Katowice (Poland) for his work in developing a cohesive European Energy Policy for the further generations.
events.notes: Received the Diamond Prize from the Regional Chamber of Commerce in Katowice in 2009.

roles: recipient of the Energy Efficiency Visionary Awards
supporting_quotes: In 2009, the Energy Efficiency Global Forum presented him the Energy Efficiency Visionary Awards for his 'outstanding contributions to the advancement of energy efficiency'.
events.notes: Received the Energy Efficiency Visionary Awards from the Energy Efficiency Global Forum in 2009.
Served as European Commissioner for Development from 2010 to 2014.

events.canonical_org_name: High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: From 2012 to 2013, Piebalgs served – alongside Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, David Cameron and others – on the High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda
events.notes: Served as a member of the High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda from 2012 to 2013.

supporting_quotes:
Leader of
Unity
In office
4 June 2016 – 19 August 2017

Between 4 June 2016 and 19 August 2017, he served as the leader of the
Unity
party.
events.notes: Served as Leader of the Unity party from 4 June 2016 to 19 August 2017.
